Authors: Carlos A. S. Lucena, Naércio A. Menezes
Title:
A phylogenetic analysis of Roestes Günther and Gilbertolus
eigenmann, with a hypothesis on the relationships of the Cynodontidae
and Acestrorhynchidae (Teleostei: Ostariophysi: Characiformes)
Abstract:
A hypothesis of cladistic relationships of the genera
Roestes and Gilbertolus is proposed based on 48 osteological and
myological characters. These two genera are included in the subfamily
Roestinae which is supported by seven synapomorphies. The Cynodontinae
is proposed as the sister group of the Roestinae and the clade Roestinae
+ Cynodontinae is demonsrated to form a monophyletic group named the
Cynodontidae; four synapomorphies were found to characterize this
family. The Acestrorhynchidae (including only Acestrorhynchus) is
proposed as the sister group of the Cynodontidae.
